intro: Gompholobium burtonioides var. subacerosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved burton's wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its small yellow flowers appear in clusters during the spring and summer months, attracting various pollinators. The variety subacerosum is distinguished by its narrower, more elongated leaflets compared to other varieties of Gompholobium burtonioides.
